original:
Hungarian art has its roots in the period of the conquest of the Carpathian Basin by the Árpád dynasty in the 9th century. Under the leadership of Prince Árpád, earlier inhabitants of the region were organized into a cohesive group. Prior to Árpád's arrival, various nomadic peoples from the steppes had established states within the Carpathian Basin.

The Huns, known as Xiongnu in Chinese historical texts, had their capital in Buda, name
